Question: According to the Associated Press, "this person was the only surgeon general to become a household name".
Hints: This person, MD (October 14, 1916 – February 25, 2013) was an American pediatric surgeon and public health administrator.
This person was known for his work on tobacco prevention, AIDS, abortion, and the rights of disabled children.
This person did not present the draft report to Reagan and claimed he never approved it.
